alert.note: Alert for West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 19 at 2:48PM MDT until April 19 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ..RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 10 PM MDT TODAY FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS, VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR MUCH OF CENTRAL, EAST CENTRAL AND NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT THURSDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH THURSDAY EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN AND NORTH CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND VERY LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY... .Windy conditions will persist through early evening, keeping the threat of critical fire weather conditions going. Temperatures will drop and cool overnight, but humidity will be unable to recover very efficiently with many zones struggling to reach 25 to 35 percent by Thursday morning. Going into the afternoon Thursday, windy conditions will redevelop with very dry air invading the area. This along with another round of unstable conditions will lead to more critical conditions Thursday afternoon, namely across central, east central and northeastern areas of New Mexico. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Mountains (Zone 105), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) until 10 PM MDT Today. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest to west 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 55 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
